articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday there could be no permanent ceasefire in Gaza until Hamas was destroyed, casting doubt on a key part of a truce proposal that U.S. President Joe Biden said Israel itself had made.
articles.title: Netanyahu says no Gaza ceasefire until Hamas destroyed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The vote share of South Africa's governing African National Congress (ANC) after this week's parliamentary election slipped further to just over 40% with results in from almost all polling stations, the electoral commission's website showed on Saturday.
articles.title: South Africa latest vote count puts ANC just over 40%

articles.author: Mike Spector
articles.description: Boeing executives are unlikely to be criminally charged over fatal crashes in 2018 and 2019 that killed 346 people as the statute of limitations has likely passed, U.S. Justice Department officials told victims' family members in a meeting.
articles.title: Boeing executives unlikely to be charged over 737 MAX crashes, source says

articles.author: Krishna N. Das, Rishika Sadam, Chris Thomas
articles.description: The coalition could win 55 to 64 seats in five southern states, nearly double what it won in 2019.
articles.title: Modi's alliance set to break India's southern ceiling

articles.author: Joey Roulette, Steve Gorman
articles.description: Boeing, whose commercial plane operations are in disarray, badly needs a win in space for its Starliner venture, a program several years behind schedule with more than $1.5 billion in cost overruns.
articles.title: Boeing Starliner capsule's first crewed test flight postponed moments before launch

articles.author: Idrees Ali
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin tried to refocus attention on China's threat in the Pacific on Saturday, seeking to alleviate concerns that conflicts in Ukraine and Gaza have distracted from America's security commitments in Asia.
articles.title: U.S. defense chief refocuses attention on China security risks

articles.author: Maria Caspani
articles.description: New York City police said on Saturday they had taken into custody more than two dozen people in connection with Friday’s pro-Palestinian protests at the Brooklyn Museum.
articles.title: Police say they detained 29 people in pro-Palestinian protests at Brooklyn Museum on Friday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party-led alliance is projected to win a majority in the general election that concluded on Saturday, an exit poll summary by the NDTV news channel said.
articles.title: TV exit poll summary projects victory for Indian PM Modi in general election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Talks aimed at reaching a global agreement on how to better fight pandemics will be concluded by 2025 or earlier if possible, the World Health Organization said on Saturday.
articles.title: Global pandemic treaty to be concluded by 2025, WHO says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Artur Chilingarov, a Russian polar scientist and explorer and veteran member of parliament, died on Saturday, the speaker of the state Duma lower house said. He was 84.
articles.title: Artur Chilingarov, Russian polar scientist and member of parliament, dies at 84
